holidays.name: National Mac and Cheese Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to celebrate the creamy, cheesy comfort food favorite: macaroni and cheese.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created to honor the classic American comfort dish beloved by millions.
holidays.funFact: Mac and cheese became popular in the U.S. after Thomas Jefferson brought back a pasta and cheese recipe from Italy.

holidays.name: World Chimpanzee Day
holidays.description: An awareness day dedicated to the protection and appreciation of chimpanzees and their habitat.
holidays.origin: Established by conservation groups to promote the protection of chimpanzees worldwide on their birth month.
holidays.funFact: Chimpanzees share about 98% of their DNA with humans, making them our closest animal relatives.

holidays.name: National Tape Measure Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration honoring the invention of the tape measure, an essential tool for measurements in daily life.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the birthday of Alvin J. Fellows, who patented the spring tape measure in 1868.
holidays.funFact: The first modern tape measure was invented by Alvin J. Fellows in 1868, revolutionizing measuring for inventors and builders alike.
